questions.question: What is the highest level in the object model?
Which core object includes the Kernel module?
Does String include the Enumerable module?
What happens when a value becomes too big for Fixnum?
questions.correctAnswer: It is automatically converted to a Bignum.

questions.question: In what order are the values of a hash iterated?
questions.correctAnswer: The order in which they were inserted.

questions.question: What are two uses of ranges?
Which is not a use of the splat operator?
wrongAnswer: Explode or expand the elements of an array.
Collect arguments of a parameter list into an array.

questions.question: Does a while block define a new scope?
Does the case statement in Ruby have fall-through behavior?
What is the meaning of self?
What does a bang (or exclamation point) at the end of a method signify?
questions.correctAnswer: A mutation on the receiver object
wrongAnswer: Ruby is excited to execute the method

questions.question: When might you explicitly use the return statement?
questions.correctAnswer: To return from a method prematurely
wrongAnswer: When the Ruby gets bored of executing
When the method causes a stack overflow

questions.question: What is a singleton method?
questions.correctAnswer: A method that is available only on a single object
wrongAnswer: A method that wants to be alone
A method that can be executed only once

questions.question: What is a factory method?
questions.correctAnswer: An initialization method that creates specialized instances of a class.
wrongAnswer: A method that is created by the Ruby Environment
A method that was born in the Industrial Revolution Era

questions.question: What is an IO object?
questions.correctAnswer: An object that can be used for file data transfer.
wrongAnswer: An object that can be used for bulk data deletion

questions.question: If more than one version of a Gem is installed, which version will be used?
questions.correctAnswer: The Gem with the highest version number.
wrongAnswer: The Gem that was installed first
Neither, Ruby hates merge conflicts just as much as you do

questions.question: What error is raised if a method is passed the wrong number of arguments?
What error is raised if method name resolution fails?
What is the difference between "puts" and "print"?
questions.correctAnswer: puts appends a newline character to the output
wrongAnswer: Ruby likes puts more than print
